result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Christene Denise Smith was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Christene Denise Smith was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain mental health assessment.  Cooperate with any treatment.

Obtain AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

Provide DNA sample  on and pay surcharge on count one only over period of probation.  The Court does not impose an additional fine as there is an inability to pay.
EACH COUNT:  Pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon sucessful completion of revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

supervisions.notes: DNA surcharge on count three waived as the Court finds an inability to pay.  Pay applicable costs, surcharges as ordered/stated on count one.
Consecutive to: Consecutive.  Good time.  Huber for work and treatment conditional upon absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Count one.
Count three.
Associated with Charge #1
Court Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.  kmw
DRIVE ASSESSMENT AND SAFETY PLAN

Count 2:  Dismissed
Counts 1 and 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
**********
Statements made as to sentencing.
Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  This sentence is STAYED and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
-Cooperate with the Department
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Obtain Mental Health assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random screens
2 year Ignition interlock
2 year driver license revocation
The court does not impose an additional fine as there is an inability to pay.

Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the house of correction, consecutive, good time; Huber for work and treatment conditional upon absolute sobriety.   The court opposed to electronic monitoring and DRC not necessary.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample on and pay surcharge on count 1 only over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  Surcharge on count 3 waived as the court finds an inability to pay.
Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Character Letters.  kmw

Defendant Christene Denise Smith in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an AMENDED INFORMATION
Count 1:  the court amended the charge to OWI 3rd, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.63(1)(a) , an unclassified MISDEMEANOR.  
Count 2:  the court amended the charge to PAC 3rd, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.63(1)(b) , an unclassified MISDEMEANOR.  
Count 3:  the court amended the charge to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1) , a class A MISDEMEANOR.  
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  kmw

Original Transcript  PRELIMINARY HEARING (15 pages) commencing APRIL 28, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Christene Denise Smith in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Lucy Kronforst for James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Stipulation to the defendant having a previous OWI offense date of February 25, 2008 and a conviction date of March 31, 2008 is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the corrections of "February 25, 2008 " and "March 31, 2008" on page 3.  Sworn for the state:Jared Manthe-West Allis Police Department Officer.  Stipulation to the blood draw results of the defendant is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed,  WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 4/28/14.
css

Court orders defendant REFERRED TO WCS for supervision upon leaving court if they are eligible for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. IF THEY FAIL TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-28-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christene Denise Smith in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
